intro: Eriosema humile, commonly known as the small-leaved eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in regions with a temperate climate and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
